across.text: About an hour changing motorway
across.explanation: AUTOBAHN(i.e. a ‚Äúmotorway‚Äù in Germany). Solution is an anagram (indicated by ‚Äúchanging‚Äù) of ABOUT AN and H (a recognised abbreviation of ‚Äúhour‚Äù).

across.text: Author on the right put off about vote
across.explanation: ColinDEXTER, creator of Inspector Morse (i.e. ‚Äúauthor‚Äù ‚Äì with apologies to any other deceased authors of his namesake ‚Äì don‚Äôt haunt me). Solution is DETER (i.e. ‚Äúput off‚Äù) placed ‚Äúabout‚Äù X (i.e. ‚Äúvote‚Äù), like so: DE(X)TER. Solution also satisfies ‚Äúon the right‚Äù. I‚Äôm sinister, which may not surprise anyone.

across.text: Order to purchase gemstone reportedly for cyborg technology
across.explanation: BIONICS(i.e. ‚Äúcyborg technology‚Äù). ‚ÄúReportedly‚Äù indicates homophone. Solution is a homophone of BUY ONYX (i.e. ‚Äúorder to purchase gemstone‚Äù).

across.text: Fiery and extreme English politician in present day
across.explanation: HOT-TEMPERED(i.e. ‚Äúfiery‚Äù). Solution is OTT (i.e. ‚Äúextreme‚Äù, being a recognised abbreviation of ‚Äúover the top‚Äù), E (a recognised abbreviation of ‚ÄúEnglish‚Äù) and MP (i.e. ‚Äúpolitician‚Äù, specifically a Member of Parliament) placed ‚Äúin‚Äù HERE (i.e. ‚Äúpresent‚Äù) and finally followed by D (a recognised abbreviation of ‚Äúday‚Äù), like so: H(OTT-E-MP)ERE-D.

across.text: Alas, your pic is spoiled as gannets take food
across.explanation: RAPACIOUSLY(i.e. ‚Äúas gannets take food‚Äù). ‚ÄúSpoiled‚Äù indicates anagram. Solution is an anagram of ALAS YOUR PIC.

across.text: Europe‚Äôs capital resides in wealthy German state
across.explanation: REICH(i.e. ‚ÄúGerman state‚Äù). Solution is E (i.e. ‚ÄúEurope‚Äôs capital‚Äù, i.e. the first letter of ‚ÄúEuropean‚Äù) placed or ‚Äúresiding in‚Äù RICH (i.e. ‚Äúwealthy‚Äù), like so: R(E)ICH.

across.text: Poisonous mushroom mother‚Äôs fed to girl
across.explanation: AMANITA(i.e. ‚Äúpoisonous mushroom‚Äù). Solution is MA (i.e. ‚Äúmother‚Äù) placed in or ‚Äúfed to‚Äù ANITA (i.e. ‚Äúgirl‚Äù, as in a girl‚Äôs name), like so: A(MA)NITA. I owe this one in part to a frightening number of hours spent gadding aboutSkyrim. AndSkyrim VR.

across.text: Ireland in round are initially one up on points?
across.explanation: BALLERINA(i.e. ‚Äúone up on points‚Äù, as in being up on one‚Äôs tippy-toes). Solution is ERIN (i.e. ‚ÄúIreland‚Äù, poetically) placed ‚Äúin‚Äù between BALL (i.e. ‚Äúround‚Äù ‚Äì a bit weak) and A (i.e. ‚Äúare initially‚Äù, i.e. the first letter of ‚Äúare‚Äù), like so: BALL-(ERIN)-A.

across.text: Rupees southern India discovered in drug island
across.explanation: CORSICA(i.e. ‚Äúisland‚Äù). Solution is R (a recognised abbreviation of ‚Äúrupees‚Äù), S (ditto ‚Äúsouthern‚Äù) and I (‚ÄúIndia‚Äù in the phonetic alphabet) placed or ‚Äúdiscovered in‚Äù COCA (i.e. ‚Äúdrug‚Äù), like so: CO(R-S-I)CA.

across.text: Perhaps Oscar is number two
across.explanation: SECOND-IN-COMMAND(i.e. ‚Äúnumber two‚Äù). Solution also satisfies ‚Äúperhaps Oscar‚Äù, referring to how O (‚ÄúOscar‚Äù in the phonetic alphabet) is the second letter of ‚Äúcommand‚Äù.

across.text: Not let Anne Dutten out
across.explanation: UNTENANTED(i.e. ‚Äúnot let‚Äù). ‚ÄúOut‚Äù indicates anagram. Solution is an anagram of ANNE DUTTEN.[EDIT: Thanks to Mark in the comments for the correction. Solution was UNTENANTED, not UNATTENDED. The grid image was correct, but my brain went wrong when writing up the solutions. Stoopid brain‚Ä¶ ‚Äì LP]

across.text: Give Spanish noblewoman note
across.explanation: DONATE(i.e. ‚Äúgive‚Äù). Solution is DONA (i.e. ‚ÄúSpanish noblewoman‚Äù, the female equivalent of a Don) followed by TE (i.e. ‚Äúnote‚Äù, in the doh-ray-me notation).

across.text: Once more throwing away a win
across.explanation: GAIN(i.e. ‚Äúwin‚Äù). Solution is AGAIN (i.e. ‚Äúonce more‚Äù) with the first A removed (indicated by ‚Äúthrowing away a‚Äù).

across.text: Putting longer, I developed a brassy technique
across.explanation: TRIPLE-TONGUING(i.e. ‚Äúbrassy technique‚Äù). ‚ÄúDeveloped‚Äù indicates anagram. Solution is an anagram of PUTTING LONGER I. Not one to stick into Google. (Right, Mick? üòâ )

across.text: Ale month shifted alcohol
across.explanation: METHANOL(i.e. ‚Äúalcohol‚Äù). ‚ÄúShifted‚Äù indicates anagram. Solution is an anagram of ALE MONTH.

across.text: Soldiers protecting heads of Asian trade mission
across.explanation: LEGATION(i.e. a diplomatic ‚Äúmission‚Äù). Solution is LEGION (i.e. ‚Äúsoldiers‚Äù) wrapped around or ‚Äúprotecting‚Äù the ‚Äúheads‚Äù or first letters of ‚ÄúAsian‚Äù and ‚Äútrade‚Äù, like so: LEG(A-T)ION.

across.text: Headless rat in eggs and cheese pastries? Take any remedy
across.explanation: CLUTCH AT STRAWS(i.e. ‚Äútake any remedy‚Äù). Solution is AT (i.e. ‚Äúheadless rat‚Äù, i.e. the word ‚Äúrat‚Äù with its initial letter removed) placed ‚Äúin‚Äù between CLUTCH (i.e. ‚Äúeggs‚Äù) and STRAWS (i.e. ‚Äúcheese pastries‚Äù), like so: CLUTCH-(AT)-STRAWS.

across.text: Pint puller needs no help to get froth on liquor
across.explanation: BARM(i.e. ‚Äúfroth on [fermenting] liquor‚Äù). Solution is BARMAID (i.e. ‚Äúpint puller‚Äù) with the AID removed (indicated by ‚Äúneeds no help‚Äù). One gotten purely from the wordplay, if I‚Äôm honest.

across.text: Note hint about card game
across.explanation: ECARTE(i.e. ‚Äúcard game‚Äù). Solution is E (i.e. a musical ‚Äúnote‚Äù) followed by TRACE (i.e. ‚Äúhint‚Äù) both reversed (indicated by ‚Äúabout‚Äù), like so: ECART-E. Another one gotten from the wordplay.

across.text: 3-D art of changing hands in clock-making
across.explanation: HOLOGRAPHY(i.e. ‚Äú3-D art‚Äù). Solution is HOROGRAPHY (i.e. ‚Äúclock-making‚Äù) with the R replaced by L (indicated by ‚Äúchanging hands‚Äù; R being a recognised abbreviation of ‚Äúright‚Äù, L being ‚Äúleft‚Äù).

across.text: US determination to change inadequate rating
across.explanation: UNDERESTIMATION(i.e. ‚Äúinadequate rating‚Äù). ‚ÄúTo change‚Äù indicates anagram. Solution is an anagram of US DETERMINATION.

across.text: Vet meeting requirements given time
across.explanation: INSPECT(i.e. to ‚Äúvet‚Äù). Solution is IN SPEC (i.e. ‚Äúmeeting requirements‚Äù, as in being within specification) followed by T (a recognised abbreviation of ‚Äútime‚Äù).

across.text: Vandyke perhaps knowing about English illustrator
across.explanation: AubreyBEARDSLEY(i.e. ‚Äúillustrator‚Äù). Solution is BEARD (i.e. ‚ÄúVandyke perhaps‚Äù, being a short pointy beard) followed by SLY (i.e. ‚Äúknowing‚Äù) once it has been wrapped around E (a recognised abbreviation of ‚ÄúEnglish‚Äù), like so: BEARD-SL(E)Y. No, me neither. Another one gotten from the wordplay.

across.text: Mixture of aluminium in molten rock on the turn
across.explanation: AMALGAM(i.e. ‚Äúmixture‚Äù). Solution is AL (chemical symbol of ‚Äúaluminium‚Äù) placed ‚Äúin‚Äù MAGMA (i.e. ‚Äúmolten rock‚Äù) once it has been reversed (indicated by ‚Äúon the turn‚Äù), like so: AM(AL)GAM.

across.text: Country concerned with peace after Conservative loss
across.explanation: REALM(i.e. ‚Äúcountry‚Äù). Solution is RE (i.e. ‚Äúconcerned with‚Äù ‚Äì think email replies, for example) followed by CALM (i.e. ‚Äúpeace‚Äù) with the C removed (indicated by ‚Äúafter Conservative loss‚Äù ‚Äì C being a recognised abbreviation of ‚ÄúConservative‚Äù), like so: RE-ALM.

across.text: Diplomat needs suit as cover for briefs
across.explanation: ATTACHE CASE(i.e. ‚Äúcover for briefs‚Äù). Solution is ATTACHE (i.e. ‚Äúdiplomat‚Äù) followed by CASE (i.e. ‚Äúsuit‚Äù). An easier get than it ought to have been, beinga recent repeat.

across.text: Evil American is into careless faker of images
across.explanation: ILLUSIONIST(i.e. ‚Äúfaker of images‚Äù). Solution is ILL (i.e. ‚Äúevil‚Äù) followed by US (i.e. ‚ÄúAmerican‚Äù) and an anagram (indicated by ‚Äúcareless‚Äù) of IS INTO, like so: ILL-US-IONIST.

across.text: Sleeping ‚Äì something not to do around Sandhurst
across.explanation: DORMANT(i.e. ‚Äúsleeping‚Äù). Solution is DON‚ÄôT (i.e. ‚Äúsomething not to do‚Äù) placed ‚Äúaround‚Äù RMA (i.e. Royal Military Academy, ‚ÄúSandhurst‚Äù ‚Äì it‚Äôs listed as RMAS in my Chambers, with no separate entry for RMA. Your dictionary may differ.)

across.text: Dangerous element runs for street in sports venue
across.explanation: RADIUM(i.e. ‚Äúdangerous element‚Äù). ‚ÄúFor‚Äù indicates a replacement is afoot. Solution is STADIUM (i.e. ‚Äúsports venue‚Äù) with the ST (a recognised abbreviation of ‚Äústreet‚Äù) replaced with R (ditto ‚Äúruns‚Äù, as used in various ball games). Spookily, the last book I‚Äôve read this week is Brooke Bolander‚ÄôsThe Only Harmless Great Thing, which is up for a World Fantasy Award next month. The novella is partly about the Radium Girls, who painted radium onto clock faces, tragically unaware of the radiation poisoning until it was much too late. Also, sentient glow-in-the-dark elephants. It‚Äôs a good read, incidentally, but takes some getting into. Anyway, moving on‚Ä¶

across.text: Hardly daunting storing film material
across.explanation: SCARCELY(i.e. ‚Äúhardly‚Äù). Solution is SCARY (i.e. ‚Äúdaunting‚Äù) wrapped around or ‚Äústoring‚Äù CEL (i.e. ‚Äúfilm material‚Äù), like so: SCAR(CEL)Y.

down.text: Steam haricots with some tongue inside
down.explanation: AMHARIC, the official language of Ethiopia (i.e. ‚Äútongue‚Äù). ‚ÄúWith some ‚Ä¶ inside‚Äù indicates the solution is hidden in the clue, like so: STE(AM HARIC)OTS. One I only got once I had all the intersecting letters filled in, and even then a brute force of my Chambers was needed.

down.text: All playing on grass put up with half time ice cream
down.explanation: TUTTI-FRUTTI(i.e. ‚Äúice cream‚Äù). Solution is TUTTI (musical lingo for ‚Äúall playing‚Äù) followed by TURF (i.e. ‚Äúgrass‚Äù) reversed (indicated by ‚Äúput up‚Äù ‚Äì this being a down clue), then TI (i.e. ‚Äúhalf time‚Äù, i.e. the first half of the word ‚Äútime‚Äù), like so: TUTTI-FRUT-TI.

down.text: Writer‚Äôs from German right, one limited by injunction?
down.explanation: BRECHTIAN(i.e. ‚Äúwriter‚Äôs‚Äù ‚Äì I‚Äôm taking this to mean ‚Äúof Bertolt BRECHT‚Äù). Solution is RECHT (i.e. ‚ÄúGerman right‚Äù, i.e. the German for ‚Äúright‚Äù) and I (i.e. ‚Äú[Roman numeral] one‚Äù) placed in or ‚Äúlimited by‚Äù BAN (i.e. ‚Äúinjunction‚Äù), like so: B(RECHT-I)AN.

down.text: US comedian‚Äôs internal struggle to be eternally optimistic?
down.explanation: HOPE AGAINST HOPE. Solution satisfies ‚ÄúUS comedian [Bob HOPE]‚Äôs internal struggle‚Äù and ‚Äúto be eternally optimistic‚Äù). A clue that scans rather well.

down.text: Ghostly tingling follows tree emitting echo
down.explanation: ELDRITCH(i.e. ‚Äúghostly‚Äù ‚Äì fans of H.P. Lovecraft will be all over this one). Solution is ITCH (i.e. ‚Äútingling‚Äù) placed after or ‚Äúfollowing‚Äù ELDER (i.e. ‚Äútree‚Äù) with the second E removed (indicated by ‚Äúemitting echo‚Äù ‚Äì E is ‚Äúecho‚Äù in the phonetic alphabet), like so: ELDR-ITCH.

down.text: Orientating car badly in unfamiliar area
down.explanation: TERRA INCOGNITA(i.e. ‚Äúunfamiliar area‚Äù). ‚ÄúBadly‚Äù indicates anagram. Solution is an anagram of ORIENTATING CAR. Another clue that scans rather well. The solution also begs to be a story title. Really cool.

down.text: Politician managed to take in English people
down.explanation: REPUBLICAN(i.e. ‚Äúpolitician‚Äù). Solution is RAN (i.e. ‚Äúmanaged‚Äù) wrapped around or ‚Äútaking in‚Äù E (a recognised abbreviation of ‚ÄúEnglish‚Äù) and PUBLIC (i.e. ‚Äúpeople‚Äù), like so: R(E-PUBLIC)AN.¬†I really ought to start using a recognised abbreviation for ‚Äúa recognised abbreviation‚Äù‚Ä¶

down.text: Rural bus curtailed ‚Äì a severe pain
down.explanation: BUCOLIC(i.e. ‚Äúrural‚Äù). Solution is BUS with the last letter removed (indicated by ‚Äúcurtailed‚Äù) and followed by COLIC (i.e. ‚Äúa severe pain‚Äù), like so: BU-COLIC.

down.text: Old unit containing unknown toxic gas
down.explanation: OZONE(i.e. ‚Äútoxic gas‚Äù). Solution is O (a recognised abbreviation of ‚Äúold‚Äù) and ONE (i.e. a ‚Äúunit‚Äù) wrapped around or ‚Äúcontaining‚Äù Z (i.e. ‚Äúunknown‚Äù ‚Äì setters love calling the letters X, Y or Z in their solutions ‚Äúunknowns‚Äù), like so: O-(Z)-ONE.

down.text: Where train stops around one with good reason to get going
down.explanation: INSTIGATION(i.e. ‚Äúreason to get going‚Äù). Solution is IN STATION (i.e. ‚Äúwhere train stops‚Äù) placed ‚Äúaround‚Äù I (i.e. ‚Äú[Roman numeral] one‚Äù) and G (a recognised abbreviation of ‚Äúgood‚Äù), like so: IN-ST(I-G)ATION.

down.text: Heavens! NHS bed places going up?
down.explanation: SKYWARDS(i.e. ‚Äúgoing up‚Äù). Solution is SKY (i.e. ‚Äúheavens‚Äù) followed by WARDS (i.e. ‚ÄúNHS bed places‚Äù, as in hospital wards).

down.text: Killer beheaded Spanish poet
down.explanation: ORCA, a ‚Äúkiller‚Äù whale. Solution is Federico Garc√≠a LORCA (i.e. ‚ÄúSpanish poet‚Äù) with the initial letter removed (indicated by ‚Äúbeheaded‚Äù). Chalk one to my Bradfords here. My knowledge of Spanish poets is almost as good as my knowledge of non-Spanish poets.

down.text: Queen‚Äôs put up in Italian city
down.explanation: SIENNA(i.e. ‚ÄúItalian city‚Äù). Solution is ANNE IS (i.e. ‚Äúqueen‚Äôs‚Äù, read as ‚Äúqueen is‚Äù), reversed (indicated by ‚Äúput up‚Äù ‚Äì this being a down clue), like so: SI-ENNA.

down.text: Picture reason for dropping coffee?
down.explanation: MUGSHOT. Solution satisfies ‚Äúpicture‚Äù and, when read as MUG [IS] SHOT (i.e. ‚Äúreason for dropping coffee‚Äù).

down.text: Indescribable hunt hold topless meet
down.explanation: UNTOLD(i.e. ‚Äúindescribable‚Äù). Solution is derived by removing the initial letters (indicated by ‚Äútopless‚Äù) ofHUNTHOLD.

down.text: The food of love, perhaps with chips?
down.explanation: ELECTRONIC MUSIC. Solution riffs on an oft quoted line from Shakespeare‚ÄôsTwelfth Night: ‚ÄúIf music be the food of love, play on‚Äù. ‚ÄúChips‚Äù, in context of the solution, represent microchips. You get the idea.

down.text: Treats cloth on side with a napper as quickly as possible
down.explanation: FULL STEAM AHEAD(i.e. ‚Äúas quickly as possible‚Äù). Solution is FULLS (i.e. ‚Äútreats cloth‚Äù ‚Äì an alternative definition of ‚Äúfull‚Äù is to scour and beat woollens) followed by TEAM (i.e. ‚Äúside‚Äù) and A HEAD (i.e. ‚Äúa napper‚Äù ‚Äì a definition supported by my Chambers), like so: FULLS-TEAM-A-HEAD.

down.text: Flamboyant wood used in old carriage
down.explanation: FLASHY(i.e. ‚Äúflamboyant‚Äù). Solution is ASH (i.e. ‚Äúwood‚Äù) placed ‚Äúin‚Äù FLY (i.e. ‚Äúold carriage‚Äù), like so: FL(ASH)Y.

down.text: The French on watch, perhaps for English martyr
down.explanation: HughLATIMER, one of the Oxford ‚ÄúMartyrs‚Äù tried for heresy in the sixteenth century and burnt at the stake. Solution is LA (i.e. ‚Äúthe French‚Äù, i.e. the feminine form of the word ‚Äúthe‚Äù in French) followed by TIMER (i.e. ‚Äúwatch, perhaps‚Äù). Another one gotten from the wordplay.

down.text: Disconcerted wife in large crowd losing key
down.explanation: THROWN(i.e. ‚Äúdisconcerted‚Äù). Solution is W (a recognised abbreviation of ‚Äúwife‚Äù) placed ‚Äúin‚Äù THRONG (i.e. ‚Äúlarge crowd‚Äù) once the G has been removed (indicated by ‚Äúlosing [musical] key‚Äù), like so: THRO(W)N.

down.text: Piano virtuoso, expert at moving pieces
down.explanation: GRANDMASTER. Solution, when read as GRAND MASTER, satisfies ‚Äúpiano virtuoso‚Äù. Solution also satisfies ‚Äúexpert at moving [chess] pieces‚Äù.

down.text: Amentia treated with hemp drug
down.explanation: AMPHETAMINE(i.e. ‚Äúdrug‚Äù). ‚ÄúTreated‚Äù indicates anagram. Solution is an anagram of AMENTIA and HEMP.

down.text: Novel sin ‚Äì just
down.explanation: VANITY FAIR, a ‚Äúnovel‚Äù by William Makepeace Thackery. Solution is VANITY (one of the seven deadly ‚Äúsins‚Äù) followed by FAIR (i.e. ‚Äújust‚Äù).

down.text: Stock film boxers perhaps avoided?
down.explanation: RESERVOIR(i.e. ‚Äústock‚Äù). Solution is RESERVOIR DOGS (i.e. a ‚Äúfilm‚Äù by Quentin Tarantino) with the DOGS removed (indicated by ‚Äúboxers perhaps avoided‚Äù).[EDIT: Thanks to Sid in the comments for the typo corrections. Much obliged, Sid! ‚Äì LP]

down.text: Store directors chasing award
down.explanation: CUPBOARD(i.e. ‚Äústore‚Äù). Solution is BOARD (i.e. ‚Äúdirectors‚Äù) placed after or ‚Äúchasing‚Äù CUP (i.e. ‚Äúaward‚Äù), like so: CUP-BOARD.

down.text: Unfortunately, it is a rum dessert
down.explanation: TIRAMISU(i.e. ‚Äúdessert‚Äù). ‚ÄúUnfortunately‚Äù indicates anagram. Solution is an anagram of IT IS A RUM.

down.text: Note way to remove fumes making acetone?
down.explanation: SOLVENT(i.e. ‚Äúacetone‚Äù). Solution SOL (i.e. ‚Äúnote‚Äù, in the doh-ray-me style) followed by VENT (i.e. ‚Äúway to remove fumes‚Äù).

down.text: Grass‚Äôs book
down.explanation: TIMOTHY. Solution satisfies ‚Äúgrass‚Äù ‚Äì as in the flora ‚Äì and ‚Äúbook‚Äù ‚Äì as in one of the books of the New Testament.

down.text: Russian‚Äôs home in Moscow, yes, before tea
down.explanation: DACHA(i.e. ‚ÄúRussian‚Äôs home‚Äù). Solution is DA (i.e. ‚Äúin Moscow, yes‚Äù ‚Äì as in the Russian word for ‚Äúyes‚Äù) followed by CHA (i.e. ‚Äútea‚Äù). One I knew, weirdly, though I can‚Äôt recall from where.

down.text: Day record set up for top prize
down.explanation: GOLD(i.e. ‚Äútop prize‚Äù). Solution is D (a recognised abbreviation of ‚Äúday‚Äù) followed by LOG (i.e. ‚Äúrecord‚Äù). The whole is then reversed (indicated by ‚Äúset up‚Äù ‚Äì this being a down clue), like so: GOL-D.
